intro: Palicourea costaricensis, commonly known as Costarican palicourea, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Palicourea costaricensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
